reviews.text: I pass through Fife during numerous trips to the NW. My group has used the restaurant location to meet up with locals because of the convenient location frequently over the years. The food is ok but nothing special compared to the other similar buffets in the area.
reviews.title: Stay Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have to travel with our business equipment because of the nature of our travel, which had never been an issue with the Emerald Queen's complex or Buffet Restaurant before. However, for my party's last visit to the buffet, we were singled out for taking our laptop computers, camera equipment, and mobile phones by security. The guard, his superior, and their superior all demanded that we leave our devices in our car while we dined in their restaurant. This, in spite of the fact that they have signs posted all over their parking lots stating the dangers of theft of valuables in cars parked in their lots, valuables should not be left in cars, and they are not responsible for items that are. When asked about that little detail, the guard stated that "valuables" are a wallet or purse, not our approx. $10K in electronics. There was no option to check the items anyplace during our visit. Just in the car or a trunk if we had had one.
reviews.title: There are better options...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We promptly left. Will never be back.
reviews.title: Slept like a baby!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can draw your own conclusions as to why a business would intentionally do this to a loyal customer, or if in their ignorance just have absolutely no respect for their client's property.
reviews.title: Spacious Clean Room; Limited Options on Casino Floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottom line, stay away. There are countless restaurants in the area that respect and value patrons to their establishments.
reviews.title: Grumpy people and Non-smoking rooms that smell like smoke.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveling through Washington when arrived at hotel front desk staff first could not find room confirmation and when they finally did they said we should never book through the internet as if it was our fault they had overbooked themselves.They made rude comments about how the Managers don't deal with it. If it had not been so late at night and I had already pre paid for the room I would have found alternate accomodations. The only room left in the place was a smoking room at first it did not smell but as the night went on whenever someone in the next room would light up our room would stink up. The hotel staff were unfriendly, never apologized for the inconvience or accept responsibility for their mistake. They were no help with bags or directions they just tried to avoid questions and when asked questions the would respond with I don't know . All the vending machines on every floor were out of order. The valets honked at people in the parking garage I have never experienced such a lack of customer service from an entire staff in my life. Even in the room there was a lack of helpful information. No hotel info or area info like what time check out was or where to eat. I will never stay at this property again and would not recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Worst Customer Service Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: there are a lot of fun and clean casinos in Washington but this is not one! This casino has guards at every intersecting hallway & they are not friendly. Our non-smoking room smelled of exhaust fumes and smoke we were almost unable to sleep it was so bad. The staff was openly hostile to questions and seemed angry to be working here. We left early and stayed at a motel 8 in federal way our second night in Washington and it was much preferred to the casino at about half the price. They even gave us maps to other local casinos that were nice and inviting. The Emerald Queen was a huge disappointment considering we planned this trip just to visit them.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were non-gamblers joining up with classmates for a 60th b'day celebration and not too sure from reviews how we'd find the hotel. Though there was a smell of smoke even in non-smoking rooms on top floor, not as bad as expected. And the room was fantastic - big, roomy, clean, a bed that was huge and comfortable and had the world's best pillows! Good-size bathroom, with sink/vanity outside - lots of storage space. P.M. maid service (straightening things, clean towels, etc.). Entire staff was friendly, courteous, helpful. Numerous police and rules on taking bottled water from hotel offputting...good buffet, nice restaurant upstairs with bar. Negatives were smoke, no gift shop/mini-mart to buy aspirin, stuff like that, and window in room that only opened an inch, when we wanted a few more to get fresh air inside. Great places to eat w/in walking distance. And what had to be the absolutely cleanest parking lot we have ever seen. This place is well-run.
reviews.title: Very Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Emerald Queen Hotel & Casino in years past. But this time was a shock because they have remolded, expanded and improved it 110%. It's casino area is larger and it has two parking decks now.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place To Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself has wonderful thick fluffy towels. The sheets on the beds are high grade and the beds themselves are great to sleep on.
reviews.title: Nice but very smoky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for several nights for a concert at the Emerald Queen Casino (which is actually a completely separate property, far away...but that's another story). We had a lot of valuables in the room, and didn't want them to be disturbed. When we left the room, we specifically left the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on the door, and didn't need / want maid service for the room.
reviews.title: LOCK YOUR VALUABLES - BLATANT INVASION OF PRIVACY & PROPERTY!

reviews.text: We returned to the room later that night, we found that the bed was made (it wasn't supposed to be), and the valuables we left on the bed and nightstand were GONE! We had a lot of souvenirs that were supposed to be on the bed, but they were no where to be found. Despite the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign, the maid came in, made our bed, threw our pajamas on the dresser, and threw away our souvenirs!
reviews.title: Overwhelmed by Smoke

reviews.text: Even though they took the time to go through our valuables and throw them away, they left our trash undisturbed!
reviews.title: Nice rooms, but no longer family-friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at dozens of hotels in the past, and this has NEVER happened to us before. It was a frightening feeling to come back to our room and to find our valuables missing. We felt very invaded.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel for a Concert

likes.liked: — The comfy beds, large clean rooms and shuttle bus to concert.

reviews.text: We booked a room here because we were attending a concert at the center. The room was fine but it was nonsmoking and you could definitely still smell smoke. The heat in the room was hard to control....either very hot or very cold. When we first arrived we asked about a sports bar and they said there were 2 over at the event center part of the casino. So we headed over there to watch some football...but were disappointed to find out that there really wasn't a sports bar at all...but just a couple of TV's, so we ended up going to Freddies casino for football and food. We stayed here for the convienence of being able to take shuttle to concert, but found out that it only ran once an hour?? concert started at 8PM so we chose to take the 8PM shuttle, which didn't show up until 8:15PM...so by the time we walked the long trek from where they dropped us off to where the concert was held it had already begun. After the concert we went to the club which had a good band to dance to. We went to catch the 2:30AM shuttle back and they said it had already left, so we ended up taking a cab that cost $13. We also ate a late night meal at the casino in the deli area and they were very unorganized and it took quite a long time to get our food.
reviews.title: Room average...smoke and shuttle terrible

reviews.text: We booked a room here only because we were going to an event at the sister property and they provide a shuttle. The room was average and met the needs of a 1 night stay, place to hang out before the concert and get ready. The shuttle to the event was very convienient both to and from. Had this room been anywhere else I would say it was average and would have been fine, but the room even though non-smoking seemed like someone was smoking right next to me. We spent very little time in the casino area, really just for check in, but when we returned home we felt the need to immediately shower to remove the smoke smell. And we left one of the bags in the car afterwards and went back to it a couple hours later and the car reaked of smoke too. Overall it was very good for the shuttle and the service was good, but the smoke smell if you are not a smoker might be too much to get past.
reviews.title: The Smoke Smell makes it almost a below average

reviews.text: Stayed 3 days at the hotel for a conference. At the time of booking I didn't know the meeting would be held at the "showroom" which was at their other casino down the road. If I had known I would have to ride a shuttle or drive to the meeting I would have chosen to stay at another hotel. This one was okay, clean, lots of room, bathroom was roomy; but the AC/heater in the wall vibrated all night. The unit was on the same side as the bed and you could feel the vibration. The room was dated and the first night it smelled like something was burning. Did not like having to walk through the smokey casino to get to the lobby. Although we had a good rate and the staff was friendly, the security folks were a little scary.
reviews.title: Umm....didn't like it.

reviews.text: Hotel is a combined hotel and casino. To get to the lobby you have to walk through a casino filled with cigarette smoke. The room smelled like smoke, emanating from the rug. The ac/fan combo could neither cool the room or get rid of the smell. Room was very clean and the little amenities were great but there is no reason to stay here. None.
reviews.title: Smoky, smelly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Girlfriend and I went to EQC and stayed for the Joan Jett concert. It was great. Customer Service was awsome, the room we got was great. Nonsmoking room did not smell like smoke, quiet rooms. Buffet was good, didnt get sick, decent selection. Definately returning!!!! The drinks were pretty weak, unless you order a double, just bring your own though!!! And the wifi sucked!!!
reviews.title: Great people, and great fun!!!!
